intro: Silene pelidna, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Silene pelidna produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
